page.title: 18THE KINGDOM OF KIPPEN
page.content: There is a story from the time of James V which tells of a "King of Kippen":The first Buchanan owner of Arnprior demanded the purchase of part of a load of a carrier going to Stirling. On being told that the load was for the King, Buchanan replied, "Tell him if he is King of Scotland I am King of Kippen and need some of my Royal Brother's provisions".The King, with retinue, duly paid a visit to Arnprior,interrupting Buchanan's meal with the announcement:"The Gudeman of Ballochgeigh humbly requests an audience of the King of Kippen".The meeting proved successful, with the King inviting His Royal Impertinence back to the Royal Palace of Stirling.
